title: Instructional Design for Assessment and Management of Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of medical terminology and understanding of neurological symptoms
context.additional_context: Aims for pre-service teachers to acquire practical skills in assessing vestibular vertigo patients in speech therapy, emphasizing simulation activities using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Able to explain the pathophysiology and diagnostic criteria of benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV).
Capable of practicing standard assessment/treatment procedures such as the Dix-Hallpike test and Epley maneuver.
Able to demonstrate the process of developing a BPPV management plan using patient education materials.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
